_header: Grievous is my sorrow / Both even and morrow
Note: Includes ‘Wo worth’ anaphora; for a religious parody cf. 1670.
_description: A song of secular love-longing — fourteen 8-line stanzas including refrain phrase, ‘That unkyndnes haith kyllyd me’

BLSl1584.First Lines: Grevus ys my soroweBoth evyne and moro…
BLSl1584.Last Lines:
…Prey for this ded bodyThat your unkyndnes haith
                    slayne
